verbs.description: overpitch (third-person singular simple present overpitches, present participle overpitching, simple past and past participle overpitched)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To give too high a pitch to.
examples: to overpitch a note in music

entries.meaning: (transitive, cricket) To bowl (the ball) so that it bounces closer to the batsman than a good length, allowing the batsman to hit it easily.
